meanings.definition: To convert data or information into a digital form that can be processed by a computer.
meanings.sent1: I will computerise the paper records into digital files for easier access.
meanings.sent2: It is important to computerise important documents to prevent loss.
meanings.sent3: Trying to computerise handwritten notes can be quite a challenge!
meanings.sent4: Her mind seemed to computerise information at lightning speed.
meanings.sent5: The software can computerise the entire process, saving time and effort.

meanings.definition: To equip with or control by computers.
meanings.sent1: We need to computerise the new office with the latest technology.
meanings.sent2: The factory decided to computerise their production line for efficiency.
meanings.sent3: The idea of computerising a toaster sounds amusing, doesn't it?
meanings.sent4: His brain seemed to computerise tasks effortlessly, like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The futuristic city was completely computerised, from traffic lights to homes.
